org.onyxplatform.api.java

Class API

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.onyxplatform.api.java.API
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OnyxNames

    public class API
extends java.lang.Object
implements OnyxNames
    Simple public facing user API mirroring all functionality of underlaying onyx API. This is a static utility class that should not be used as an Object, but should instead be used on objects.

        public static java.lang.Object startEnv(EnvConfiguration envConfig)
        Starts a development environment using an in-memory implementation of ZooKeeper.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        object representing the started environment

      • startPeerGroup

        public static java.lang.Object startPeerGroup(PeerConfiguration peerConfig)
        Starts a set of shared resources that are used across all virtual peers on this machine. Optionally takes a monitoring configuration map. See the User Guide for details.
        Parameters:
        peerConfig - peerConfig object used to specify peerGroup startup conditions
        Returns:
        peerGroup object representing machine specific resource config

      • startPeers

        public static java.lang.Object startPeers(int nPeers,
                                          java.lang.Object peerGroup)
        Launches n virtual peers. Each peer may be stopped by passing it to the shutdown-peer function.
        Parameters:
        nPeers - number of virtual peers to start
        peerGroup - peerGroup configuration object specifying peer runtime conditions
        Returns:
        peers object holding n virtual peers

        Parameters:

      • shutdownPeer

        public static java.lang.Object shutdownPeer(java.lang.Object peer)
        Shuts down the virtual peer, which releases all of its resources and removes it from the execution of any tasks. This peer will no longer volunteer for tasks. Returns null.
        Parameters:
        peer - Object representing peer to be shutdown
        Returns:
        null

      • shutdownPeers

        public static java.lang.Object shutdownPeers(java.lang.Object peers)
        Like shutdownPeer, but takes a sequence of peers as an argument, shutting each down in order. Returns null.
        Parameters:
        peers - An object representing the sequence of peers to shutdown
        Returns:
        null

      • submitJob

        public static clojure.lang.IPersistentMap submitJob(PeerConfiguration peerConfig,
                                                    Job job)
        Takes a peer configuration, job map, and optional monitoring config, sending the job to the cluster for eventual execution. Returns a map with success keyword indicating if the job was submitted to ZooKeeper. The job map may contain a metadata key, among other keys described in the user guide. The metadata key may optionally supply a job-id value. Repeated submissions of a job with the same job-id will be treated as an idempotent action. If a job has been submitted more than once, the original task IDs associated with the catalog will be returned, and the job will not run again, even if it has been killed or completed. If two or more jobs with the same job-id are submitted, each will race to write a content-addressable hash value to ZooKeeper. All subsequent submitting jobs must match the hash value exactly, otherwise the submission will be rejected. This forces all jobs under the same job-id to have exactly the same value.
        Parameters:
        peerConfig - peerConfig object specifying peer behavior
        job - job object specifying job
        Returns:
        IPersistentMap containing the started job object

      • killJob

        public static boolean killJob(PeerConfiguration peerConfig,
                              java.lang.String jobID)
        Kills a currently executing job, given its job ID. All peers executing tasks for this job cleanly stop executing and volunteer to work on other jobs. Task lifecycle APIs for closing tasks are invoked. This job is never again scheduled for execution.
        Parameters:
        peerConfig - peerConfig object
        jobID - ID of job to kill
        Returns:
        true/false status dependent on job kill effort

      • gc

        public static boolean gc(PeerConfiguration peerConfig)
        Invokes the garbage collector on Onyx. Compresses all local replicas for peers, decreasing memory usage. Also deletes old log entries from ZooKeeper, freeing up disk space.
        Parameters:
        peerConfig - peerConfig object
        Returns:
        true/false status of garbage collection effort

      • awaitJobCompletion

        public static boolean awaitJobCompletion(PeerConfiguration peerConfig,
                                         java.lang.String jobID)
        Blocks until job-id has had all of its tasks completed or the job is killed. Returns true if the job completed successfully, false if the job was killed.
        Parameters:
        peerConfig - peerConfig object
        jobID - ID of currently running job
        Returns:
        true (job complete) or false (job killed)
